sanskrit_verse:
उत्पत्तिरेव विप्रस्य मूर्तिर्धर्मस्य शाश्वती ।
स हि धर्मार्थमुत्पन्नो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥ १.९८॥
transliteration:
utpattireva viprasya mūrtirdharmasya śāśvatī |
sa hi dharmārthamutpanno brahmabhūyāya kalpate || 1.98||
sph_interpretive_translation: The eternal form of Dharma is the very birthright of the twice-born; he who is born for the sake of Dharma is destined for the realization of Brahman.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from alignment with Dharma, not social position
Causation originates in consciousness, not external action
Capacity-based responsibility arises at birth through Varna-dharma alignment
Restoration logic operates through reconnection to Brahman-consciousness
Consciousness alignment supersedes all juridical frameworks
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Adjudication, a dvija's inherent capacity for Dharma realization establishes his threshold of ultimate responsibility. Judgment must prioritize restoration to Brahman-consciousness over societal correction.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causality flows from consciousness, not external acts. Thus, sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) begins with inner alignment. Responsibility is proportional to one’s innate Dharma capacity, and justice serves only reintegration, never punishment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Vedic study protocol to restore dharmic memory
Assign guru-guided sādhanā to realign consciousness
Reconnect individual will with cosmic Dharma flow
Establish svadhyaya tribunal for self-revelation of misaligned actions
Deploy yajña-based purification to dissolve karmic residue
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma stands executed. Justice flows from consciousness, not compulsion. Reality is non-punitive. Brahman alone adjudicates.
